content.description: Sit start w left hand crimp and right crystal jug, climb straight up w a tricky move that works the middle.
content.location: Climbs front of first stand-alone visible immediately after walking under train bridge.

content.description: Begin hands-matched on a hidden incut crescent undercling, in the roof, hanging block for feet. Move left out of the undercling, through a sloper, into the incut hold above. Continue right around the lip, (and without the low right detached block or dabbing) mantle.

Sit start below the short roof, hands matched on the juggy top of the detached block, feet compressing it. Move up and right across the crimps, through the solid slopey lip, and shuffle onto the right adjacent block.

Begin sitting, traverse the ledge left, turning the corner into the slab face. Crux: continue left through the edge into a jug, navigating tricky feet.

 Right variation: cut right through incut holds, with thin feet, geometric finish. Totally different from the left side, slightly less quality, length, and difficulty.
content.protection: Pad, watch out for the stump.

content.description: Awkwardly stand/mantle start on the slab and top out like Comfy Shell. Project: Even more awkwardly sit start.
content.location: 50 feet to the right of Llama’s Skull, right weird slab of Comfy Shell.

content.description: Laying start in the crack. Enter the sloping bulge overhead and climb left into the holds of Contrarian to top out, with unique movements.It may be possible to sit start to the right, but it’s very dabby due to a small rock which could potentially be removed.
Sit start below the cracked bulge, hands matched in the left leaning crack, a foot in a pocket along the crack. Move left, topping out on the left side of the crack. Cryptic beta

Sit start on the low left side (left detached rock is on @v0), traverse right into a crack (variation: go straight up using the detached block to top out), follow it right around the corner and top out.
content.protection: Pad the rock below the top out
content.location: 50 feet to the right of the Llama’s Skull at the edge of the rock formations.

content.description: Sit start below the cracked bulge, left hand on a juggy ledge inside the left leaning crack, right hand in the crack, a foot pocket lower right along the crack. Move right, topping out on the right side of the crack, being careful not to dab. Discouraging for the grade yet satisfying movement, final hold is Sharp.

Climb the slightly overhung rectangular block nestled in the rocks facing the marsh, about 25 feet to the right of Comfy Shell. Start below the lip, climb into an empty box-hold and top out so you can decide to jump down.
content.location: Nestled in the rock formation to the right of Llama’s Skull.

content.description:
Begin with the first move of Cactuar; Sit start with sharp overhead jug, grab the left big sloping scoop. Traverse left into the small ledge with a series of cruxy moves until you are matched. (V0 from here) top out using the left top edge.

 Classy moves, but low feet are somewhat chossy. Once you are familiar with this type of rock, sharpness is less intense.
content.location: 30 feet into the woods, up a small hill after the train tunnel, can’t miss.

content.description:
Start low for fun, climb through jugs at the lip into the titled ledge, ascend to safety with a tenuous high hand on the left arete. Kind of a one move wonder, and halting.

 Catscade Project: sit start on the right end of the short ledge, below a blocky corner, low crescent lefty jug, right hand verticalish rail. Bump the right hand to an optimal position higher on the rail, twist and make a very stretched out throw from horizontal to the lip. From here you will enter tiny incut crimps.. there’s no choice but to mantle, and hope on 1/9 lives you don’t go flying backward into the talusy corridor.
content.protection: Pad (multiple and hopefully a spot for the right side)
content.location: Right of cat tower, and further right still for the projy

content.description: Sit start right of the large sloper, below a sharp jug. Grab the sloper and climb (w a reachy foot) into crimps on the slab, to top out.
content.location: First boulder visible after the tunnel.

content.description: This is a well-worn trail through the forest alongside some boulders. The wind blows softly through the cattails carrying the scent of nearby salt marsh. It is shadowy here.   Meow the catfolk   Meow says in common:   ‘Sit start below the short prow, hands matched atop the detached block, feet compressing it. Climb through crimps and top out above the lip using the slopers directly overhead.’
Sit start, hands matched in the large horizontal slot, throw for the friendly top hold and top out.
content.protection: 2 pads for the pointy rock under the landing.. also don’t hit the tree.
content.location: Boulder to the right of Comfy Shell.

content.description: Small bouldering area, directly off the Branford trail in Bunny Boulder Area, Stony Creek.
